lead_paragraph: Nikki Caldwell, who assisted Pat Summit at Tennessee the past six seasons, was hired to coach U.C.L.A.’s women’s team. Caldwell, 35, is only the fifth women’s coach in U.C.L.A. history. She succeeds Kathy Olivier, who resigned last month after 15 years on the job. The Bruins were 16-15 last season.
